sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"尊重，钦佩"之意。
means: admire ：侧重指对某人或某物的仰慕、钦佩，并含欣赏爱慕之情。
honour ：侧重指对某人或某物表示极大的敬意。
respect ：指对人的行为、品德、才华或成就等的仰慕尊重。尤指对年长或地位高的人的尊敬。
regard ：最正式用词，中性，含义不很明确，一般需用修饰语加强或明确其意。
esteem ：除表示尊敬之外，还暗示由此而产生的称赞。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含有"认为"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: consider, think, believe, count, deem, reckon, regard
means: consider ： 指经过考虑和观察后得出的结论。
think ： 普通用词，指按照自己的意见提出看法。
believe ： 通常指根据一定的证据，经思考后而认为属实。
count ： 指作出判断后而得出的看法等。
deem ： 正式用词，常用于法律、文学，强调作判断而不是思考。
reckon ： 指对人或事作全面"权衡"，把各方面意见考虑进去后得出结论。
regard ： 侧重凭外表或表面现象作判断。多强调观点。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"尊敬，尊重，敬意"之意。
means: respect ： 指对年长、地位较高的人的尊敬，对他人成就、行为或见解等经过仔细评估后而表示尊重，暗示在上述人面前表现谦恭和有礼貌。
honour ： 指对长辈或有地位、有名望、有功劳的人公开表示极大敬意或软佩。
regard ： 最正式用词，中性，与respect和honour近义。
esteem ： 除表示尊敬之外，还暗示由此可而产生的称赞。
admiration ： 指除表示尊敬外，还常伴随有一种真挚的倾慕之情。

sentence.Network_en: English has hurt me a thousand times, but I still regard it as my first love.
sentence.Network_cn: 英语伤我千百遍，我待英语如初恋。

sentence.Network_en: Try to view situations more objectively, especially with regard to work.
sentence.Network_cn: 要尽量客观地分析情况，尤其是在工作上。

sentence.Network_en: He has said he will fire editorial employees without regard to seniority.
sentence.Network_cn: 他说过不管资历如何，任何编辑人员他都有可能解雇。

jx.jx_en_mean: in connection with the point previously mentioned

lj.lj_ly: there was little incentive for them to be active in this regard.
lj.lj_ls: 在这一点上，还缺乏促使他们积极主动的激励。

phrase.cizu_name: with (或 in 或 having) regard to

jx.jx_cn_mean: 关于，至于；就…而言，在…方面

lj.lj_ly: he made enquiries with regard to Beth.

phrase.cizu_name: in regard to 或 with regard to

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French regarder 'to watch', from re- 'back' (also expressing intensive force) + garder 'to guard'

entry.def: If you regard someone or something as being a particular thing or as having a particular quality, you believe that they are that thing or have that quality.

example.ex: He was regarded as the most successful Chancellor of modern times...
example.tran: 他被认为是现代最为成功的财政大臣。

example.ex: I regard creativity both as a gift and as a skill.
example.tran: 我认为创造力既是一种天赋也是一种技巧。

entry.tran: 对…怀有（某种感情）;以（某种感情）看待
entry.def: If you regard something or someone with a feeling such as dislike or respect, you have that feeling about them.

example.ex: He regarded drug dealers with loathing...
example.tran: 他对贩毒分子深恶痛绝。

example.ex: Displays of emotion are regarded with suspicion...
example.tran: 情感的流露会招致猜疑。

entry.def: If you regard someone in a certain way, you look at them in that way.

example.ex: She regarded him curiously for a moment...
example.tran: 她好奇地看了他一会儿。

example.ex: The clerk regarded him with benevolent amusement.
example.tran: 这个职员好心而又饶有兴趣地看着他。

entry.def: If you have regard for someone or something, you respect them and care about them. If you hold someone in high regard, you have a lot of respect for them.

example.ex: I have a very high regard for him and what he has achieved...
example.tran: 我非常钦佩他的为人和成就。

example.ex: There were armed people about, people with little regard for human life...
example.tran: 到处都是武装分子，视人命如草芥。

entry.tran: 问候，致意（尤用于信中表示问好）
entry.def: Regards are greetings. You use regards in expressions such as best regards and with kind regards as a way of expressing friendly feelings towards someone, especially in a letter.

example.ex: Give my regards to your family...

example.tran: 请转达我对玛丽的良好祝愿。

entry.def: You can use as regards to indicate the subject that is being talked or written about.

example.ex: As regards the war, Haig believed in victory at any price.
example.tran: 至于这场战争，黑格认为要不惜任何代价取得胜利。

entry.def: You can use with regard to or in regard to to indicate the subject that is being talked or written about.

example.ex: The department is reviewing its policy with regard to immunisation.
example.tran: 这个部门正在审度其有关疫苗接种的政策。

entry.tran: 在这/那方面；就这/那一点
entry.def: You can use in this regard or in that regard to refer back to something that you have just said.

example.ex: In this regard nothing has changed...
I may have made a mistake in that regard.
example.tran: 我在那一点上可能已经犯了一个错误。

means.word_mean: 1. (usually preceded by `in') a detail or point;
2. paying particular notice (as to children or helpless people);

sentences.sentence: "he spends without heed to the consequences"

means.word_mean: 3. (usually plural) a polite expression of desire for someone's welfare;

sentences.sentence: "he fixed his paternal gaze on me"

means.word_mean: 5. the condition of being honored (esteemed or respected or well regarded);

sentences.sentence: "a man who has earned high regard"

means.word_mean: 6. a feeling of friendship and esteem;

sentences.sentence: "she mistook his manly regard for love"

means.word_mean: 7. an attitude of admiration or esteem;

sentences.sentence: "She views this quite differently from me"
"I don't see the situation quite as negatively as you do"

auth_sentence.content: Georgia continues to regard it as a breakaway region.
auth_sentence.res_content: Georgia continues to regard it as a breakaway region.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Georgia continues to regard it as a breakaway region.

auth_sentence.content: The responsibilities of pharmacists in this regard are murky.
auth_sentence.res_content: The responsibilities of pharmacists in this regard are murky.

auth_sentence.content: Today, many young women regard this world differently.
auth_sentence.res_content: Today, many young women regard this world differently.

Sentence.sentence: This week's announcement of a new iPhone by a management team led by Tim Cook, who replaced Mr Jobs as chief executive in August, was generally regarded as competent but uninspiring.
The school randomly assigns roommates without regard to race
Regarding gender role building, social learning theories attach greater importance to socialization in one's childhood than in their adulthood or later life.

Researchers studying teenagers in Israel concluded that, in that hazardous environment, mobile phones were regarded as "security objects" in parent-teen relationships―important because they provided the possibility ofcontact and communication at all times
They are regarded as the nation's driving force of change.

sentences.en: You never regard what I say.
He has always regarded his father's advice very highly.
sentences.cn: 他一向很尊重父亲的意见。

means.word_mean: 注意；听从[常用于否定句]

sentences.en: This matter does not regard them at all.
sentences.cn: 这件事与他们毫无关系。

sentences.en: More regard must be paid to safety on the roads.
sentences.cn: 必须更加注意公路上的交通安全。

sentences.en: You have no regard for my feelings!
sentences.cn: 你没有考虑到我的感情！

sentences.en: I hold her in the greatest regard.

means.word_mean: （用于信函的结尾或转达问候）致意，问候

sentences.en: Please give my regards to him.

jushi.english: His work is highly regarded by other painters.
jushi.chinese: 他的作品受到其他画家的高度评价。

jushi.english: Since then his work has been highly regarded.
jushi.chinese: 从那之后,他的工作就很受重视了。
